channel.title: Played head on interface(with helm,beard etc.)

item.title: Played head on interface(with helm,beard etc.)
item.dc:creator: @dutchboy dutchboy
item.description:
@dutchboy wrote:

With this you can place your players head on interface, like in my showoff(welcome screen nd minigame)

For now its NON, but renaming soon.

NON
Add this method into your class9

private static void addHead2(int i, int width, int height, int zoom) {
		Class9 class9_2 = addTab(i);
		class9_2.anInt262 = 6;
		class9_2.anInt269 = zoom;
		class9_2.anInt270 = 40;
		class9_2.anInt271 = 1900;//166
		class9_2.anInt267 = height;
		class9_2.anInt220 = width;
	}

RENAMED

private static void addHead2(int i, int width, int height, int zoom) {
		RSInterface class9_2 = addTab(i);
		class9_2.type= 6;
		class9_2.anInt269 = zoom;
		class9_2.anInt270 = 40;
		class9_2.anInt271 = 1900;//166
		class9_2.height = height;
		class9_2.anInt220 = width;
	}

Usage:

addHead(Id, WithOnInterface, HeightOnInterface, zoom);

For zoom you should use something between:
1000-3500

Renamed will be here in a few mins

You might also need this one:
NON

    public static Class9 AddTab(int i)
    {
        Class9 class9 = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
        class9.anInt250 = i;
        class9.anInt236 = i;
        class9.anInt262 = 0;
        class9.anInt217 = 0;
        class9.anInt214 = 0;
        class9.anInt220 = 512;
        class9.anInt267 = 334;
        class9.aByte254 = 0;
        class9.anInt230 = 0;
        return class9;
    }

RENAMED

    public static RSInterface addTab(int i)
    {
         class9 = interfaceCache[i] = new RSInterface();
        class9.id = i;
        class9.parentID = i;
        class9.type = 0;
        class9.atActionType = 0;
        class9.anInt214 = 0;
        class9.width = 512;
        class9.height = 334;
        class9.aByte254 = 0;
        class9.anInt230 = 0;
        return class9;
    }
